Cells

Cells are meant to hold an individual value. That value can be a constant (e.g. 50 or 'red') or it can be a constraint (e.g. x+1 or Math.sqrt(y)) that recalculates its value based on a formula that uses the properties of this or other objects.

To change a cell's value, click it and type a new value. Press [enter] to confirm or [esc] to cancel.

Again, use [ctrl]+z and [ctrl]+[shift]+z to undo and redo any changes you make to your program.

try changing the values of x, y, and z in the example below:
